title: Traveled to Poland
description: Had an amazing winter trip to Poland
extendedDescription:
I went to Poland this winter to surprise a friend and ended up having one of the best trips ever. Gdańsk welcomed me with snow, Christmas lights, and the smell of hot wine. I spent my days ice skating, exploring the markets, and trying every local food I could find.

After that, I headed to Kraków, visited Auschwitz, wandered through the old streets, and took a trip to the mountains in Zakopane. Between the snowy hikes, hot springs in Chochołowskie Termy, and speeding around on a snowmobile, I fell completely in love with Polish winters.

title: Tikki
description: I adopted my little cat Tikki
extendedDescription: It was 2020, in the middle of the pandemic, when I was sitting at a T3 alone and isolated. I made one of the best decisions of my life and adopted my little cat Tikki. Ever since then it has been my best companion and friend.

title: Started University
description: Began my Informatics and Computer Engineering Integrated Master's degree at U.Porto - FEUP.
extendedDescription:
In 2016, I kicked off one of the biggest chapters of my life: university. I came in ready for it, so I partied hard, studied harder, and learned a ton, not just from books, but from life itself.

It was a crazy mix of everything: new friends, late-night study marathons, deadlines, projects, and those all-nighters where coffee basically became part of my bloodstream. Looking back, it was a time of growth, discovery, and some of the best memories I’ve got.

title: Team Leader at Dive Studios
description: Led the project development of an educative rocket simulator prototype.
extendedDescription:
During 2021, in the context of the subject 'LGP' (Project Management Laboratory) I got the opportunity to lead a team of 8 programmers, and be the communication bridge between the team, the client and the multimedia department.

The project ended up being a success at the eyes of the team, the client and our end users, given the measure tests we did in real schools.

It was a huge opportunity for me to be able to lead the development of this project, not only for the leadership skills, but also for the first contact with Unity and game development in general.

Ended up with a grade of 19.

title: Can You Make? it participation
description: Applied for the 'RedBull Can You Make It?' challenge.
extendedDescription:
During this year, me and two other friends decided to apply for the 'RedBull Can You Make It?' challenge. We had to create video that would promote the challenge and the most liked videos would be selected for a travel across Europe, using only RedBull cans as currency.

Unfortunately we weren't selected, but it was a fun journey, all the ideation, the video recording, the sharing and promoting of the video. It was fun even with all the disappointments.

title: Twitch Streams
extendedDescription:
I found out one of my biggest passions this year. I was a dedicated League of Legends player, and decided to start streaming it to share the journey of my dreams: Becoming a Challenger!

I was a Silver player back when I started and throughout my journey I ended up reaching Diamond and building up a strong and reasonable community that supported me.

 Made friends, reached an average of 15-20 viewers per stream and created a discord server where around 10 people would be joining almost every single night to chat and play together, creating amazing memories.

 This was also the moment where I started creating my first personal brand (TOA), I explored a lot my artistic and design skills to achieve the results I wanted for the branding of my Stream and was always cumplimented for the quality I delivered.

title: Graduated Bachelor's Degree
description: Completed my Software Engineering Bachelor's degree with honors.
extendedDescription:
After a few detours, a lot of work and sleepless nights, I was finally able to graduate successfully with a 13 GPA on my bachelors.

 Highliting my best performance in: Algebra (17), Graphical Applications Laboratory (16), Database and Web Applications Labortory (18) and Personal and Interpersonal Proficiency (16).

title: Tools Lead at Saber Interactive
description: Founded de Tools department and became the Tools Lead Programmer.
extendedDescription:
After a successful journey in the multiplayer department, I was offered the opportunity to pick up and lead the development of a core tool for the Road Kings project. 

With this the tools department was formerly started in Saber Porto and I became in charge of closing the communication and pipeline gaps between the programmer and art teams as well as developing tools to speed up and automate processes.

It was an amazing opportunity to solidify my leadership skills and my knowledge in the field of game development.

title: Started primary school
description: Completed a challenging mountain hiking expedition and discovered new perspectives.
